channel.description: Recent content in bookmarklets on David Collantes

item.title: Bookmarklets I use
item.description: These are some of the general bookmarklets I use. I have them synchronized with Chrome and Google Docs, but I am listing them here in case I want to share them with someone else, like you (yes, you there, reading this now). Here there go: Tweet it! Translate to English Google Dictionary Get Youtube MP4 Record your screen URL to QR Code Selection to QR Code More will be added as I find the need for something else.

item.title: SuperGenPass update
item.description: SuperGenPass: A Free Bookmarklet Password Generator Chris Zarate has updated his SuperGenPass bookmarlet, which now has it’s own dedicated domain. Version 1.1 comes with (from the website): Moveable window: The SuperGenPass window can be moved by dragging the title bar. Smarter password capturing: When multiple master passwords are found, the conflict must be resolved by double-clicking the desired field. Smarter autopopulate: Autopopulate is on by default, but only for fields where the master password was found.

item.title: Single sign on
item.description: Since I am going to start migrating all my web logins to a single sign on approach (using Chris Zarate SuperGenPass), I think the best way to start is by saving the bookmarklet I will have to use over and over. There is a Greasemonkey version available, which has much more features than this bookmarklet version. I will use the latest because it works with all browsers. The bookmarklet is: Single Sign on.
